I will continue to work with all parties to ensure that the order is followed and that Vernon moves one step closer to resolving the toxic nightmare of the Waste Mountain at 3 Silver Spruce Drive and see that Joe Wallace is brought to justice.
This is a clear victory for clean air and clean water in the town of Vernon and due, in no small part, to the tireless work of the community in Vernon and the local officials from the area.
Once that evidence is reviewed, Joe Wallace will have 120 days to dispose of any and all material that fits the definition of solid waste on the property.

A judge citing "clear and convincing evidence of irreparable harm," has ruled that the DEP must be granted access to the waste mountain in Vernon, along with documentation of the source and nature of all materials brought to the property in the last 10 years.

The people of Vernon, Mayor Shortway, and @PaidVernon scored a huge win in court today with a sweeping order for Joe Wallace to begin to the remediation process of the Waste Mountain on his property at 3 Silver Spruce Drive.
